result.execSummary:
The defendant Andria K Madison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF175 and 15CF173 called together at 10:02am [mo]
[Hearing on Determination of Ability to Pay]
No appearance by either defendant or counsel for defendants
ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Svehlek, Ms. Madison, Mr. Bilodeau, and Atty. Scholz enter the courtroom at 10:04am

Ms. Madison sworn and testifies
--Direct examination by Atty. Svehlek
--Cross examination by ADA Hall
--questioning by the Court

Mr. Bilodeau sworn and testifies
--Direct examination by Atty. Scholz
--Cross examination by ADA Hall
--questioning by the Court

Arguments given by Atty. Svehlek

ADA Hall cites case law re: ability to pay

Arguments given by Atty. Scholz

The Court adopts as to each Defendant the work history that they have testified.
The Court makes findings as to Defendant's earning abilities

The Court finds that over the course of Probation Ms. Madison has the ability to pay $13, 270
The Court finds that over the course of Probation Mr. Bilodeau has the ability to pay the full amount of restitution that has been ordered. 

The JOC should reflect the numbers cited by the Court as the Defendant's ability to pay(if there is a place for the ability to pay on JOC, otherwise the courts order on this record should stand)

recess: 11:00am
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:47pm [mo]
Defendant Andria K Madison in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance; submits Victim Impact Statement

ADA Hall motions to amend Count #2, as reflected in the CCS, to Theft of Movable Property(>$2500 - $5000)- As A Party to a Crime, Repeater, a Class I Felony
--The Court grants this Motion as set forth in the CCS

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Amended Count #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
recess:2:56pm--reconvene: 3:00pm[Court reviews the Victim Impact Statement]
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Madison

On Amended Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--Criminal Thinking Course of some kind determined by the Agent
--Parenting Class
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand
--No Contact with Sawyer Wallace
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay restitution to Gregory Rudolph in the amount of $13,080 (joint and several with Co-Defendants)
--to pay extradiction fees in the amount of $3,180.37

The Court finds that Ms. Madison does have the ability to pay costs during duration of Probation 
Days credit for time already served:  68  days
recess: 3:30pm

Case called at 2:03pm [mo]
Defendant Andria K Madison in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

On Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond:
--Arguments given by Atty. Svehlek
--ADA Shock does not oppose to the motion with some additional conditions

The Court grants the Defendant's Motion to Amend the Signature Bond, with modified conditions. 

The Court requires a co-signer of this bond

The Court amends Ms. Madison's bond to $10,000 signature bond, with conditions
--not to leave state of Wisconsin
--reside at the home of Glenn Schneider at W2741 Rock River Paradise Rd., Watertown, WI 53094 (shall Mr. Schneider move within Jefferson County, WI, Ms. Madison may move with him)
--no contact with Alexander J Bilodeau
--no contact with Gregory Rudolph 
-- (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.)
---to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
recess: 2:16pm
Status conference at 10-19-2015 02:30 pm
Defendants motion to modify bond
Scheduling Notice

Cases 15CF175 and 15CF173 called at 9:02am [mo]
Co-Defendant Andria K Madison in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. 
Co-Defendant Alexander Bilodeau in court with Attorney Patricia Padurean

ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance in both files

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Discovery has been received and has further investigation to conduct.
Atty. Svehlek requests that the Court address Ms. Madison's letter requesting bond modification.
Atty. Svehlek orally that bond be modified to a signature bond, with same non-monetary conditions; gives argument in favor of bond modification. 
ADA Shock indicates that he was unaware that this motion was being brought before the Court at this time; objects on basis of timing and no motion filed.
The Court grants the State's objection; Atty. Svehlek is to file a written Notice and Motion for Bond Modification and schedule a hearing with the Court's JA.

Atty. Padurean indicates that Discovery has been receieved and has further investigation to conduct
Atty. Padurean indicates that Defense has filed a Motion for Bail Modification; gives argument.
--ADA Shock does not object to the Bond Modification

On 9/15/15: The Court amends Mr. Bilodeau's to include the exception that Mr. Bilodeau may discuss with Ms. Madison pre-natal care regarding their child and their child's future post-delivery. 

Atty. Svehlek indicates that a Prelim Waiver occurred in Ms. Madison's case
Atty. Padurean indicates that a Preliminary Hearing has NOT occurred in Mr. Bilodeau's case.
recess in case 15CF175: 9:18am
recess in case 15CF173: 9:18am

Cases 15CF173 and 15CF177 called together at 9:42am
Co-Defendant Alexander Bilodeau in court with Attorney Patricia Padurean
Co- Defendant Sawyer J Wallace in court with Attorney David Makovec

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess:9:48am

[MK] case called at 1:30pm. 
Defendant Andria K Madison appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Ms. Madison indicates that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct.  She is intending to reside at her father's home in Fort Atkin
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court will schedule the Preliminary Hearing within the 10 day time limit. 

The Court requires a $2,500 cash bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Alexander J Bilodeau--this prohibition is excepted only for contact for medical purposes, and for no other purposes
--no contact with Gregory Rudolph
--no presence at N6723 Waldmann Lane in the Township of Farmington
---to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--to take all prescription medications as prescribed
--not to engage in any scrap-metal selling
recess 1:39pm. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 8/3/15 at 9:00am.
